alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 12:29PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND... A series of atmospheric rivers will move across the northern half of Southeast Alaska starting early Thursday near Yakutat, and then sliding over the northern inner channels on Friday. The heavier rain is then expected to last through the weekend. From early Thursday to late Saturday night around 2 to 7 inches of rainfall is expected overall. The highest amounts are expected over the northeast gulf coast including Yakutat. The northern inner channels will be in the middle to lower end of that range with lower values the farther SE you go. Some uncertainties on total rainfall as terrain could cause some local areas to get more or less rainfall. Local rivers and streams are expected to rise as a result of this rainfall. At this time, flood potential is low, but rivers may reach or get near bankfull conditions. People who recreate along rivers and streams across the northern panhandle should remain alert. For any updated information on this evolving event visit weather.gov/juneau.
